item.title: What does this code do?
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“MrFun, post:1, topic:525883”][center][left]Now I been adding throwing items such as rune throwing knifes but I don’t understand what the

public int maxRangeHit() { double d = 0.0D; double d1 = playerLevel[playerRanged]; d += 1.399D + d1 * 0.00125D; d += d1 * 0.11D; client AttackingOn2 = (client) server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn];

Does/Understand it. I would like to know what numbers I need to put for my throwing items such as throwing knifes.
I’m not sure what I did but heres what I put for the rune throwing knifes

if(playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 868) //checks if the player has the following arrow equipped (868) { d *= 1.74D; } else

Thanks for your help[/left][/center][/quote]

the

public int maxRangeHit() { double d = 0.0D; //variable of the damage-factor double d1 = playerLevel[playerRanged]; //gives the task to check the range lvl d += 1.399D + d1 * 0.00125D; //damage factor d += d1 * 0.11D; // the damage factor what will increase depends which level u are in range client AttackingOn2 = (client) server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn]; // handles the attacking

if(playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 868) { d *= 1.74D; //damage factor } else

I’m not sure, with that all, but it should be. Please feel free to correct me

Read full topic

item.title: What does this code do?
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

[center][left]Now I been adding throwing items such as rune throwing knifes but I don’t understand what the

public int maxRangeHit() { double d = 0.0D; double d1 = playerLevel[playerRanged]; d += 1.399D + d1 * 0.00125D; d += d1 * 0.11D; client AttackingOn2 = (client) server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn];

Does/Understand it. I would like to know what numbers I need to put for my throwing items such as throwing knifes.
I’m not sure what I did but heres what I put for the rune throwing knifes

if(playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 868) { d *= 1.74D; } else

Thanks for your help[/left][/center]

Read full topic
